description: Minor admendment (non material) for variation of condition 52 (BREEAM) of planning permission P092187 dated 30 April 2010
decision_conditions:
CONDITION
Evidence confirming that the development achieves a BREEAM rating of not less than ’Very good’ and Code of Sustainable Homes rating of no less than ‘Level 3 for the southern building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning authority. The evidence shall be provided in the following formats and at the following times:

	Residential
a)	a design stage assessment supported by relevant BRE interim certificate(s) shall be submitted at pre-construction stage prior to commencement of superstructure works on the southern building
b)	a post–construction assessment supported by relevant BRE accreditation certificate(s) shall be submitted following the practical completion and prior to the first occupation of the southern building.

Commercial
a)	a design stage assessment shall be submitted prior to the commencement of superstructure works on the southern building:
b)	a BRE interim certificate shall be submitted following the internal fit out and prior to the first occupation of the relevant unit:
c)	a BRE accreditation certificate shall be submitted following the internal fit out and prior to the first occupation of the relevant unit: 

The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change there from shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority
REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies Env1 and Env2 of the Islington UDP (2002), and 4A.1 and 4A.2 of the London Plan (Consolidated with Alterations since 2004).
CONDITION AND REASON 52 OF PLANNING PERMISSION REF P092187
